Create a float object

Source: R/mooring.R
float.Rd

Create a float object, either by looking up a known object from the database, or defining a new type.

float(
  model = "Kiel SFS40in",
  buoyancy = NULL,
  height = NULL,
  diameter = NULL,
  CD = NULL
)

Arguments

model

character value indicating the type of float. There are three possibilities for model. (1) If this is "?", then the function returns a vector of permitted character values. (2) If it is recognized, i.e. if that type is stored in data(mooringElements), then the that stored value is used, and all other arguments to this function are ignored. (3) Otherwise, a new float object is created, using values specified in the other arguments (all of which must be supplied).
buoyancy

numeric value indicating buoyancy. For wire elements, this is buoyancy per length, expressed in kg/m. For other elements, it is buoyancy, expressed in kg. Note that buoyancy is ignored if model is recognized.
height

numeric value for the height (in m) of the element. This value is used in the computation of (a) the mooring geometry and (b) the area of the element (which is in turn used in the drag computation). Note that height is ignored if model is recognized.
diameter

numeric value for the diameter (in m) of the element as viewed from a horizontal direction. This is used to compute area, for drag calculations, as pi*(diameter/2)^2. Note that diameter is ignored if model is recognized.
CD

numeric value (unitless) for the drag coefficient. Note that CD is ignored if model is recognized.

Value

float returns an object of the "mooring" class and "float" subclass.

Details

Note that HMB in a name is a short-hand for Hydrofloat Mooring Buoy. Data for these floats was extracted from Reference 1 on 2021-05-19 by Dan Kelley, with the CD value being set at 0.65 (in the absence of any data from the manufacture) because that value is used in Dewey's dataset for many floats.

References

  1. https://deepwaterbuoyancy.com/wp-content/uploads/hydro-float-mooring-buoys-deepwater-buoyancy.pdf

See also

Other functions that create mooring objects: anchor(), chain(), instrument(), release(), wire()

Author

Dan Kelley

Examples

library(mooring)
# List known float types
float("?")

#>  [1] "16in Viny"                           
#>  [2] "17in glass"                          
#>  [3] "28in ORE"                            
#>  [4] "3 pack Viny 12b-3 floats"            
#>  [5] "30in float"                          
#>  [6] "37in ORE"                            
#>  [7] "41in ORE"                            
#>  [8] "48in ORE"                            
#>  [9] "54cm Alum CAP3"                      
#> [10] "54x30inClamShell"                    
#> [11] "61in ORE"                            
#> [12] "a2 package adcp and 2 Viny balls"    
#> [13] "ADCP / 2x c3 subs assembly"
